question: 歌謡曲
sourceMnemonic:
You already learned that <ja>歌謡</ja> means "song," so when you add <kanji>music</kanji> to that it becomes a super <vocabulary>popular song</vocabulary>. It's not just a song anymore. It's in everything you hear!

More broadly, this can refer to a whole genre of Japanese pop music from the Showa era. In other words, it refers to <vocabulary>retro J-POP</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>Showa-era pop music</vocabulary>. The word <vocabulary>kayokyoku</vocabulary> is sometimes used for it in English too.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
